Package jackstockley.addressbook

Class Person

java.lang.Object
jackstockley.addressbook.Person
public class Person
extends java.lang.Object
This class holds all the necessary commands to create a person object, and to perform full CRUD on the person table of a given database.
Version:
2.6
Author:
jnstockley

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Person()
    Creates a person object with all the fields set to either 0, 0.0 or an empty string
    Person​(int id, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String middleName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String homePhone, java.lang.String mobilePhone, java.lang.String workPhone, java.lang.String homeEmail, java.lang.String workEmail, double height, double weight, java.lang.String gender, java.lang.String race, int addressID, int occupationID)
    Creates a person object with the date and time as empty fields mainly used for updating a person
    Person​(int id, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String middleName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String homePhone, java.lang.String mobilePhone, java.lang.String workPhone, java.lang.String homeEmail, java.lang.String workEmail, double height, double weight, java.lang.String gender, java.lang.String race, int addressID, int occupationID, java.lang.String date, java.lang.String time)
    Creates a person object with no empty fields mainly used for getting all people

    Creates a person object with the id and date and time as empty values

    Person updatePerson​(java.sql.Connection conn, int id, Person updatedPerson)
    Updates a singular person on the database and returns the new person To keep existing data from the current person set height and weight to 0.0, set addressId and occupationId to 0 or other fields to empty strings, excluding id, date, and time

  • Constructor Details

    • Person

      public Person()
      Creates a person object with all the fields set to either 0, 0.0 or an empty string

    • Person

      public Person​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String middleName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String homePhone, java.lang.String mobilePhone, java.lang.String workPhone, java.lang.String homeEmail, java.lang.String workEmail, double height, double weight, java.lang.String gender, java.lang.String race, int addressID, int occupationID)
      Creates a person object with the id and date and time as empty values
      Parameters:
      firstName - The first name of the person
      middleName - The middle name of the person
      lastName - The last name of the person
      homePhone - The home phone number with no dashes length of 10
      mobilePhone - The mobile phone number with no dashed length of 10
      workPhone - The work phone number with no dashed length of 10
      homeEmail - The home email of the person
      workEmail - The work email of the person
      height - The height of the person in centimeters
      weight - The weight of the person in pounds
      gender - The gender of the person
      race - The race of the person
      addressID - The address id which corresponds to an address on the database
      occupationID - The occupation id which corresponds to an occupation on the database

    • Person

      public Person​(int id, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String middleName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String homePhone, java.lang.String mobilePhone, java.lang.String workPhone, java.lang.String homeEmail, java.lang.String workEmail, double height, double weight, java.lang.String gender, java.lang.String race, int addressID, int occupationID)
      Creates a person object with the date and time as empty fields mainly used for updating a person
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the person
      firstName - The first name of the person
      middleName - The middle name of the person
      lastName - The last name of the person
      homePhone - The home phone number with no dashes length of 10
      mobilePhone - The mobile phone number with no dashed length of 10
      workPhone - The work phone number with no dashed length of 10
      homeEmail - The home email of the person
      workEmail - The work email of the person
      height - The height of the person in centimeters
      weight - The weight of the person in pounds
      gender - The gender of the person
      race - The race of the person
      addressID - The address id which corresponds to an address on the database

    • Person

      public Person​(int id, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String middleName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String homePhone, java.lang.String mobilePhone, java.lang.String workPhone, java.lang.String homeEmail, java.lang.String workEmail, double height, double weight, java.lang.String gender, java.lang.String race, int addressID, int occupationID, java.lang.String date, java.lang.String time)
      Creates a person object with no empty fields mainly used for getting all people
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the person
      firstName - The first name of the person
      middleName - The middle name of the person
      lastName - The last name of the person
      homePhone - The home phone number with no dashes length of 10
      mobilePhone - The mobile phone number with no dashed length of 10
      workPhone - The work phone number with no dashed length of 10
      homeEmail - The home email of the person
      workEmail - The work email of the person
      height - The height of the person in centimeters
      weight - The weight of the person in pounds
      gender - The gender of the person
      race - The race of the person
      addressID - The address id which corresponds to an address on the database
      occupationID - The occupation id which corresponds to an occupation on the database
      date - The date the person was created
      time - The time the person was created

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Person person)
      Checks all the fields of both people and checks if they are equal ignoring case
      Parameters:
      person - The person that is being checked
      Returns:
      Either true if all the fields are equal or false if at least one field is different

    • getAllPeople

      public java.util.List<Person> getAllPeople​(java.sql.Connection conn)
      Creates a list of people stored on a database and returns the people list
      Parameters:
      conn - The MySQL connection
      Returns:
      Either returns a list of people or null if there was an error getting all the people

    • getSimilarPeople

      public java.util.List<Person> getSimilarPeople​(java.sql.Connection conn, java.lang.String field, java.lang.String data)
      Creates a list of similar people stored on a database and returns the similar people list
      Parameters:
      conn - The MySQL connection
      field - The field used to determine if a person is similar
      data - The value for the passed field to determine if a person is similar
      Returns:
      Either returns a list of similar people or null if there was error getting similar people

    • getSingularPerson

      public Person getSingularPerson​(java.sql.Connection conn, int id)
      Retrieves a singular person based on the passed ID and returns it
      Parameters:
      conn - The MySQL connection
      id - The ID of the person to be returned
      Returns:
      Either the requested person from the database or null if there was an error getting the person

    • updatePerson

      public Person updatePerson​(java.sql.Connection conn, int id, Person updatedPerson)
      Updates a singular person on the database and returns the new person To keep existing data from the current person set height and weight to 0.0, set addressId and occupationId to 0 or other fields to empty strings, excluding id, date, and time
      Parameters:
      conn - The MySQL connection
      id - The id of the person to be updated
      updatedPerson - The new person that is going to be updated
      Returns:
      Either returns the person passed, confirming the update or null if the person was not updated

    • insertPerson

      public Person insertPerson​(java.sql.Connection conn, Person newPerson)
      Inserts a new person into the database
      Parameters:
      conn - The MySQL connection
      newPerson - The new person this is going to be inserted into the database
      Returns:
      Either returns the passed person, confirming the insert or null if the person wasn't updated

    • removePerson

      public boolean removePerson​(java.sql.Connection conn, int id)
      Removes the person at the passed id from the database
      Parameters:
      conn - The MySQL connection
      id - The ID of the person to be removed
      Returns:
      Either true if the person was removed or false if it wasn't
